website_summaries.verdict: A high quality product at a more reasonable price range than comparable options.
pros: Only turns on and operates when temperatures are cold enough to freeze, meaning it uses less power
Carries a 4-year warranty, so you can count on its longevity
cons: Offered at a lower price than others on the market, but it's still expensive per foot of cable

customer_reviews.title: Protection heat Cable works on Gutter Drainpipe
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to keep my gutter drainpipe flowing during the cold snowy months. I had one significant snowfall where it covered my gutter but I could see that the heating cable was doing the job because although the gutters was filled with snow the drain opening was free of snow. it will be interesting to see how it works as the Winter progresses.
customer_reviews.author: Willie L. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Hoping this works!
customer_reviews.text: The cable came quickly with the tape. It is installed ready for winter. The directions for installation could be so much better. We installed underground and the best explanation was a drawing at the end. Sure wish the multiple uses were outlined better with a supply list. We needed aluminum tape and fire retardent insulation to wrap around our pipe. I called twice for assistance but though the gentlemen was very polite I am not sure he was of any help. We figured it out and now we wait. Since it’s buried and only works when it’s 37 degrees Fahrenheit we may never know for sure if it works. Here’s hoping to no frozen pipes.
customer_reviews.author: Fannie

customer_reviews.title: The Best...hands down
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on any other products claiming to remove or prevent ice dams. This stuff is quality, and it works! I layed this on 6 inch thick ice and it melted through it in 8 hours and by 24 hours I could puck up the blocks left and throw them off the roof. Keeps the eves ice free and the gutters open! I will never be without this stuff in ice and snow country!
customer_reviews.author: Brian D.

customer_reviews.title: Good old USA quality!
customer_reviews.text: Bought early to change out 6 year old heat tape before next winter so has not been installed yet. Quality of product is excellent and allows you to wrap pipe with overlapping which many other products don’t. Does cost more but but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Stan K.

customer_reviews.title: Reason for Heat tape
customer_reviews.text: What I like is the length 60 feet. I will be installing it on my sewer pvc pipe. The sewer pipe froze this past winter. My problem is that I have a mobile home and the sewer pipe runs on the ground under the home. With lack of snow to insulate the skirting was the culprit..
customer_reviews.author: Fern

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I don't write a lot of reviews but this deserves one. Our sump discharge line is not barried and obviously will freeze in cold weather. I've tried all kinds of methods to keep it insulated and nothing has really worked until I found this. I put this on the bottom of the discharge line and covered it with pipe insulation and zip tied it all together and it worked perfectly. No more waking up at 3 am in freezing weather to check my sump. Other heat tape restrictions made them unusable. This is the solution I was looking for. Customer service was helpful too
customer_reviews.author: Fritz Koenig

customer_reviews.title: No frozen water!
customer_reviews.text: Put this on my freshwater hose surrounded by foam insulation and have not had any issues with frozen water in my RV so far this winter. Super happy with the product and the ease of installation. If I need to replace this in future years, I'll definitely invest in another one of these without a doubt.
customer_reviews.author: kwhyh

customer_reviews.title: High quality looking cable!
customer_reviews.text: Although the quality of the cable looks to be top notch, unfortunately it failed me from following all the instructions in testing this cable before installing. I requested a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Cigarjohn47

customer_reviews.title: Quality - Quality is Job Number One With This Manufacturer. Oh, made in America counts as well.
customer_reviews.text: Quality made product. Installed as directed via instructions. Expecting many seasons of use. Cannot see where anyone would be going wrong in purchasing this product for they're own use. Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: American Patriot

customer_reviews.title: someone should have invented this long ago
customer_reviews.text: used this to wrap sump effluent pipe, so I hope next year won't be the third time my sump pipe freezes and then in spring causes water to overflow in basement! I didn't install this, I got my neighbor to do it--he thought it was fairly simple to figure out but did take some work. Also had to buy some extra tape.
customer_reviews.author: L. Willson

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I use it for a fresh water hose. It took a little effort to get it attached, zip ties, tape and insulation for my application.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce T

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Have this 12' Heat Cable in a critical sump pump application. Follow directions, do not insulate the sensor which monitors outside air temp. Nice product with excellent instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Just in time for winter
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, have been using this for several weeks, appears to be well designed, and activates when temp is 37 or so.
customer_reviews.author: Red Rock Bunny

customer_reviews.title: You need to put  foam insulation on the pipe in addition  to the tape per instructions
customer_reviews.text: It seem to be doing the job ,no frozen pipes, yet it is still early into the winter Easy to install if not in a two foot crawl space You will need to buy more nylon or electric tape to secure to the pipe
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: After sale service great with a wait
customer_reviews.text: This is a review update. I originally gave a low rating due to weak tech support. Since then, the company owner called me to personally provide extensive application support for an unusual and difficult installation. I now feel great about the product and support for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Humphries

customer_reviews.title: easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This heat tape was easy to install, even though the included fiberglass tape is annoying because it doesn't want to stick.
customer_reviews.author: Tiva

customer_reviews.title: Great product! US based support from the frozen tundra of the north Midwest!
customer_reviews.text: Loved his product I bought it x3! I plugged it in and sandwiched the thermostat part of the line between two bags of ice I had in the freezer and the lines warmed right up!!
customer_reviews.author: Elisa Miller

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts with this, but here we are in the freezing cold and the cable isn't froze to the inside of my down spout drain pipe. My neighbor and i both had an underground drain pipe project. They chose not to use one. I did, and theirs is frozen.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Great cable - Great support!
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought - I had technical questions, called the company, spoke to Brooke and she was awesome. The cable installed easily and I'm not worried about pipes freezing. Seems like a really well-made product.
customer_reviews.author: Lani

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I used it to keep my waste water line on my camper from freezing. It worked well.
customer_reviews.author: B Baker

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I called the company before buying the heat cable. They were very helpful and answered all of my questions. It's a little more expensive than other similar items but it's well worth it. The quality is very good and the guarantee is twice as long as that offered by other companies. I'm very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Sheridan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heat tape
customer_reviews.text: Great heat tape. Easy to install. Great instructions, so far works great.
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: Good investment.
customer_reviews.text: So far It has been what was stated from the seller.
customer_reviews.author: HDJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Heavy duty and well made
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Kept pipes in barn unfrozen in -15 degree F weather this weekend. Wrapped in 1/2 inch foam rubber sleeve great combo.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Klinedinst

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS
customer_reviews.text: Works just as expected. Was easy to apply. Very good product and great customer service if you have questions
customer_reviews.author: SLP

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a good product
customer_reviews.text: Have had freezing temps. My sump pump discharge line has not frozen so far. Has not gotten really cold for a long time since i install it . so far seem fine.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Still in box but it is exactly what I need
customer_reviews.author: Richard R.

customer_reviews.title: High quality, Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Install is pretty simple. It helps to be able to overlap the cables and jump from one run to another. Owner was really helpful answering questions. Hasn't been cold enough to check performance but thus far it seems like a quality product with great service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Professionally manufactured.
customer_reviews.text: This tape will keep the cold water pipe coming into my garage from freezing where it comes up through the floor. The garage isn't always heated
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Tabor

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived as described. Time will tell, appears to be quality constructed. Excellent instructions for those that need them. Would definitely purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Canine Guardian

customer_reviews.title: Kept my drain pipe open
customer_reviews.text: Kept my drain pipe open all winter. easy to install. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: HG

customer_reviews.title: Great Product...worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: For years we struggled during cold weather to keep our grey water drain pipe open during temps below 15 degrees. This product has worked flawlessly all winter long. I would highly recommend to others with the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we were looking for
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly as described by seller. We received it quickly. The product works like a charm! We are ready for winter.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality product! You can tell when you pick it up, it’s made extremely well, my guess is this will last you for years for whatever application you apply. Great products from this company!
customer_reviews.author: Pappy./9

customer_reviews.title: Baby, Its Cold Outside
customer_reviews.text: Used this on the roof to create a valley and it worked!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Hall

customer_reviews.title: Waiting for results
customer_reviews.text: I received my product. I ordered 2 - 30 ft rolls of the heat tape. In the description, I was supposed to receive the fiberglass tape with each order. I only received one roll. Will install soon, and see how it works.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Monda

customer_reviews.title: The material it’s made of is good quality
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 1” plastic water line coming into my camp from a cistern for showers and dishes!
customer_reviews.author: Monty

customer_reviews.title: Heat tape is a breeze to install!
customer_reviews.text: I liked how easy it was to install. I don't have a heated basement so it will insure that my pipes stay unfrozen. You sell a great product. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: michaelsjoland

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Never used a heat cable before, but this seemed very heavy duty and high quality. Hopefully it does the trick this winter
customer_reviews.author: Seth Zink

customer_reviews.title: It works! (So far.)
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Installed inside the pipe, it’s worked to thaw and keep a shallow-buried drain line flowing. This weeks subzero temps forecast for Michigan will tell the story.
customer_reviews.author: Wexport

customer_reviews.title: wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: This product was very easy to install, and it unfroze my pipes within minutes! Since putting it on I have not had my main freeze.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Resh

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a high quality cable
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipment. Looks like a quality product and I've installed it on my incoming house water line (which froze 2 weeks ago). Hope it doesn't get that cold again real soon, but now I'm ready!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality
customer_reviews.text: Super high quality and worked really well on my RV plumbing.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Miner

customer_reviews.title: High quality, well made, recommended!
customer_reviews.text: The heating cable was just as described, very high quality and nicely packed. Instructions were concise and helpful. Super quick shipping and nice after purchase follow up. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Gencarelli

customer_reviews.title: Heat cable did not wotk
customer_reviews.text: I tested cable left plugged for 10 min,cable did not heat up.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Keep them pipes winter warm .
customer_reviews.text: Great product . Hopping for a smooth warm winter in Alaska !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chef

customer_reviews.title: 80 ft heat line for camper in the back 80!
customer_reviews.text: The product was easy to use. The digging in my yard was not... I am waiting for cold weather for a final outcome.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to heat a condensing line in a walk in freezer. Works good!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Didn't heat up right out of package
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE PRODUCT ! Plugged in cable for over a hr and NEVER heated up
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: Arrived right on time and seems to work great. I love that it powers up automatically when it gets cold (37 degrees) and turns off when it warms up, thus only powered when needed. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Hedgpath

customer_reviews.title: Can't wait to try
customer_reviews.text: Haven't got to use or install yet, quality seems phenomenal. Thick tough cable & heavy duty. Hope to get alot of use out of it
customer_reviews.author: Jerimiah Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup !
customer_reviews.text: Very easy setup ! Now I am ready for when the temps get below zero.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hickey

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great product well made very durable, just remember it kicks on at 38deg and off at 55deg. You cannot test it inside a warm house and it will not work with an extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

product_meta.title: Heat Cable for Pipe Freeze Protection, 18 feet, with Built-in Thermostat and 16 Feet of High-Temp Installation Tape, Heavy-Duty, Self-Regulating, 120 volt
product_meta.description: Size:18 FeetTHIS CABLE WILL NOT WORK unless it is in a cold environment. We've received a couple bad reviews because people 'tested' the cable in their warm living room. Eye roll. Please don’t be that guy. The built-in thermostat will NOT TURN THE CABLE ON unless it is in a cold environment. Now for the good news, this kit includes 16 feet of high temperature glass cloth tape for installing your cable. Pipe Freeze Pro is a commercial-grade, self-regulating heat cable which provides years of reliable freeze protection for pipes of all varieties, including copper, steel, PVC, ABS, PEX and more (pipe diameters up to 2”). It may also be used in drains and culverts through the winter months to promote drainage. Don’t buy from companies without a human available by phone. Heat cable is technical stuff and it’s great to have solid advice on how to install it. We are the only heat cable seller on Amazon who is a simple phone call away. Eat that off shore competitors! Pipe Freeze Pro is jacketed with a commercial-grade fluoropolymer and comes standard with a flame-retardant thermoplastic interior jacket. Our 16 gauge heating wires are 200% thicker than the conductors found in cheap, constant wattage cables like EasyHeat and Frost King. Thicker conductors mean greater heating efficiency, more melting power and long term cable integrity. Pipe Freeze Pro is self-regulating, meaning it ‘asks’ for more energy as it gets colder outside and less energy when it’s warmer. The entire length of our cable is temperature sensitive such that colder areas demand more power than warmer areas. Smart stuff. The stated cable length DOES NOT include an additional 24” unheated cold lead. For example, a 6 foot cable is 6 feet plus 2 feet of unheated cord. Installation is simple. Run Pipe Freeze Pro along the pipe, secure with fiberglass cloth tape (included) every 12 inches and wrap with standard pipe insulation. Read the manual for full instructions, of course.
feature_bullets: THIS CABLE WILL NOT TURN ON UNLESS IT IS IN A COLD ENVIRONMENT. We’ve received a couple bad reviews from people testing the cables in their living rooms. Please don’t be that guy.

AMERICAN SUPPORT: Knowledgeable, Minnesota-based company with expert support staff you can actually speak to! We are excited to help with your installation questions. Email us at info@radiantsolutionscompany.com
TAPE INCLUDED: 16 feet of high-temperature glass cloth tape is included with this cable.

HEAVY DUTY: Integrated thermostat turns cable on at 37 degrees, off at 50 degrees, greatly reducing energy waste. Cable is 8mm wide and includes a 24” unheated cord (add to stated cable length). Cable has commercial-grade outer jacket for long life and carries a FOUR YEAR WARRANTY, which is double the warranty of similar cables on Amazon. Will not short or burn out if cable is overlapped.
USES: Use on the inside or outside of all types of water carrying pipe including copper, steel, PVC, ABS, PEX, concrete and more; can be exposed directly to water and is rated for soil contact.

specifications.Included Components: 16 feet of high-temperature glass cloth tape
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars143 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
